page.title: 13S.E.LUTON - ARCHITECTURE
page.content:
A landscape view of this area of the town shows a diversity of building styles resulting from redevelopment designed to meet the 20th Century problems of population'overspill'and sub-standard housing.Here can be seen examples of'high-rise'and'low-rise tower blocks,the latter occupied by the elderly and infirm,Victorian and modern terraced accommodation,and the 'semi-modern',semi-detached houses of the 1930's with their larger gardens.
An innovative,low cost and time-saving building method employed in the con- struction of the modern,Wimpey rebuilt terrace in Surrey Street was the 'Nofines'method of forming the moulded one-piece shell of each house from a special poured concrete mix.Bricks were used only for the garages. {N.W.
